titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Sir Walter Scott Collection
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 06:30
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists primarily of letters from Scott to various correspondents, including James Ballantyne, John Wilson Croker, and Mary Ann (Watts) Hughes; and writings by Scott, including The House of Aspen and The Talisman.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ongoing collection of documents acquired by gift and purchase from various sources. Type of accession (gift or purchase) and date of acquisition is noted in the box-and-folder list. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Sir Walter Scott Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Sir Walter Scott Collection. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing card set in the Manuscripts Catalog, or from another inventory. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained. If the collection also contains unlisted or unsorted material, this has been noted in the box-and-folder list. This finding aid will be updated once final folder numbering and labeling have been completed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This finding aid encompasses accessions of single manuscripts and small groups of manuscripts and other papers, by or pertaining to Sir Walter Scott, which the library has chosen to group and list as an artifical collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accompanied by original agreement between James Ballantyne and Constable & Co. for Quentin Durward dated 1821 Sep 3 and by engraving of Sir Walter Scott. Gift, 1973.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accompanied by typescript. Robert Balmanno was secretary of the Artist's Fund, and publisher.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Purchase, 1952.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gift, 1953.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Purchase, 1956.

did.unittitle: ALS to Messrs. Cadell & Davis, Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: With 2 LS with initials C & D, London, 1801 Dec 29, 1802 Feb 23 on p. 2 and 3, with portrait. Purchase, 1959.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accompanied by a manuscript transcript of both letters. Gift, 1943.

did.unittitle: ALS to [Messrs. R & J] Cockburn, Castle Street

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gift, 1944

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bound by Wallis in green full morocco. Accompanied by portrait and printed memoir.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gift, 1943.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describing his northern tour, and inquiring for the author of the Reedwater minstrel . The author of the Reedwater Minstrel was Rob Roxby. Gift, 1941.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gift, 1926

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One of Scott's three trustees, concerning publication and financial matters. Purchase, 1942.

did.unittitle: Letter to Lady Katherine Halket, Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Purchase, 1958.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accompanied by a carbon typescript. From the William Harris Arnold collection. Gift, 1944.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Signature cut off. Purchase, 1952.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Purchase, 1965.

did.unittitle: AL, signed with initials, to [James] Hogg

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Removed from James Hogg's Poetic Mirror , London, 1816 Purchase, 1930.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gift, 1954.

did.unittitle: 42 ALS and 2 AL to Mrs. Mary Ann (Watts) Hughes, various places

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accompanied by a typewritten copy of "Extracts etc. not printed in Letters and recollections of Sir Walter Scott " Purchase, 1952.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gift, 1936.

did.unittitle: ALS to Sir Woodbine Parish, Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Purchase, 1955.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gift, 1926.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gift, 1957.

did.unittitle: ALS to Owen Rees, the publisher, Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gift, 1926.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions a visit from Washington Irving. Accompanied by typewritten transcript. Purchase, 1938.

did.unittitle: Letter to Spottiswood & Robertson, Solicitors, with a fragment in Scott's hand

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Inserted in Scott's personal copy of the British Bankruptcy and Jury Acts, published in 1814 and 1815. The Acts are bound together, with blank leaves between, with manuscript forms of Interlocutors in Sequestration, not in Scott's hand, but with corrections by Scott.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gift, 1926.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Diccon the Reaver" mentioned in this letter refers to Surtees' poem "The reever's penance." Gift, 1926.

did.unittitle: ALS to Mr. John Williams, Jermyn Street

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: With manuscript notes on Scott and Williams. Purchase, 1956.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: With typewritten transcript, engraved portrait and clipped signature. Gift, 1955.

did.unittitle: ALS to an unnamed correspondent, Edinburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Purchase, 1960.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gift, 1950.

did.unittitle: Letter in the third person in an unidentified hand extending a dinner invitation to Mr. Sharpe.

p.title: The House of Aspen, a tragedy founded upon a German Story

did.unittitle: The original manuscript on paper, written in the hand of an amanuensis, but with numerous corrections in the author's autograph. The whole of the fifth act is in Walter Scott's hand.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bound in red morocco, by Orrock, with the Marquess of Lothian's arms. Purchase, 1932.

did.unittitle: Manuscript in an unidentified hand, with a few corrections by Scott.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Paper watermarked 1799. Autograph of O. Rees; subsequently in the library of Dr. Thomas Rees. Bound in brown calf. Gift, 1954.

did.unittitle: Review of Charles Maturin's novel Women; or Pour et Contre

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph manuscript. Inlaid and bound with the manuscript is the printed review, as it appeared in the Edinburgh Review , June 1818. Gift, 1926.

did.unittitle: "Sir Walter Scott and Mr. Wilkie", galley proof of a "Letter from Sir Walter Scott to Sir Adam Ferguson..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: At head of caption in Scott's hand: "Morning Chronicle, Monday 15 Oct. 1827 and one correction in the text. With ALS to Mr. Balmanno, Abbotsford, 1827 Aug 2; heavily corrected proof of the same article (with slight changes) as it appeared in The Bijou , London 1828; printed copy of article from The Bijou ; typescript of Scott's additions and corrections; and a portrait of Sir Walter Scott. Purchase, 1943.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Page proofs with autograph manuscript corrections and additions; with criticisms and comments in the hand of the printer, James Ballantyne, and Scott's replies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bound in are 6 ALS to James Ballantyne, [1825?]. Bookplate of Charles George Milnes Gaskell. Bound in brown russia. Gift, 1952.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph manuscript poem. Mounted with fragment in 16th century Italic hand, labeled "Phil Melancthon, cut from margin of his copy of Plutarch's Lives."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph manuscript, bound, with notes and corrections. Purchase, 1939.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fragment (about 60 words) of the autograph manuscript. Accompanied by another fragment with note, "Thomas Thomson Esq. from W Scott" in the latter's hand, and a photograph of a portrait of Scott.

did.unittitle: Penciled memorandum of directions for a trip to the Trossachs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gift, 1926

did.unittitle: Page of manuscript describing a battle between the Saracens and Christians

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gift, 1926

did.unittitle: "Particulars of charges for Messrs. Constables Proportions of the different editions 'Lay of the Last Minstrel'"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuscript accounts in an unidentified hand.

did.unittitle: Typewritten list of autograph letters, manuscripts and miscellaneous papers of Scott that comprised the collection of his attorney, John Gibson and purchased by Hugh Walpole from John Howell.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: With 2 TLS to Wilmarth S. Lewis from John Howell, 1952. Gift, 1952

did.unittitle: Letter to Spottiswood & Robertson, Solicitors, with a fragment in Scott's hand

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Inserted in Scott's personal copy of the British Bankruptcy and Jury Acts, published in 1814 and 1815. The Acts are bound together, with blank leaves between, with manuscript forms of Interlocutors in Sequestration, not in Scott's hand, but with corrections by Scott. Gift, 1926.

unittitle.title: The House of Aspen, a tragedy founded upon a German Story

did.unittitle: The original manuscript on paper, written in the hand of an amenuensis, but with numerous corrections in the author's autograph. The whole of the fifth act is in Walter Scott's hand.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bound in red morocco, by Orrock, with the Marquess of Lothian's arms. Purchase, 1932.

did.unittitle: Manuscript in an unidentified hand, with a few corrections by Scott.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Paper watermarked 1799. Autograph of O. Rees; subsequently in the library of Dr. Thomas Rees. Bound in brown calf. Gift, 1954.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Page proofs with autograph manuscript corrections and additions; with criticisms and comments in the hand of the printer, James Ballantyne, and Scott's replies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bound in are 6 ALS to James Ballantyne, [1825?]. Bookplate of Charles George Milnes Gaskell. Bound in brown russia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bound by Wallis in green full morocco. Accompanied by portrait and printed memoir. Gift, 1927.
